page.title: 07Ashurst Church
page.content:
The Church of St. James, Ashurst. Diocese of Chichester. The earliest part of the building dates from the late 12 century. An aisle, south chapel and south west tower were added about 1200. The chancel was rebuilt in 1720 as part of an extensive restoration programme. The south porch was rebuilt during a second restoration 1877. This programme also rebuilt the tower.
'The font, vamping horn and memorial by John Flaxman are the only important fittings. Michael Fairless, author of 'The Roadmender', is buried in the churchyard.'
F.W.Steer, Handbook to Ashurst Church. (cont.)
